availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John M. Rice (Bath County, Kentucky, farm hand)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmhand and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John E. Rice and Margaret Brown Rice. Student in Bath County in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in Bath County in 1850. Farmhand in Bath County in 1860. Household owned nine enslaved persons in Bath County in 1860. Served in the 68th Kentucky Enrolled Militia (U.S.A.) as a quartermaster sergeant from May 21, 1864, to June 22, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Division 2, p. 22A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Division 2, p. 269.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 27.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 80A.
